item.title: Using array of structs in C Functions [solved]
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

edit: solved using something similar: http://cboard.cprogramming.com/c-programming/114106-pass-struct-array-function.html#post849309

edit: i think i got it to work, but im having issues with the prototype method.

[hr]
I have a struct:

struct Foo { char words[22]; }
in my main something like this:

main() { struct Foo s[100]; //initialize everything in s to be test. //call printing_function(/*pass s to the function*/); //<--this is what i need help with :c }

I know that I would have to pass a pointer to this function but I don’t know the syntax.
I would like to write a function that will print this array out and then modify s[1].words to be “done”, how would i do it? sample code please?

Read full topic
item.source: Using array of structs in C Functions [solved]
